title: Missing server name in error 516 notification msg.
author: daves127
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
If RDP disconnects, Notifications 'should' provide server name in error 516, like it does for error 260.
   -- RDP disconnected!  516 Remote Desktop canΓÇÖt connect to the remote computer <**computer name here**> for one of...

## Current Behavior
   -- RDP disconnected!  516 Remote Desktop canΓÇÖt connect to the remote computer for one of...
  -- RDP disconnected!  260 Remote Desktop can't find the...

comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.
comments.author: robertpopa22

comments.snippet:
Follow-up triage: current code path already injects host into disconnect notifications via `ProtocolEventDisconnected` formatting in `ConnectionInitiator.Prot_Event_Disconnected`. 
 
- Formatter includes host placeholder `Host: \"{1}\"` (`Language.ProtocolEventDisconnected`) 
- Runtime passes `strHostname` into that placeholder before logging 
 
Reporter also confirmed they can no longer validate and requested stale closure. Recommend close as stale/resolved unless someone reproduces on lat...
comments.author: robertpopa22
